title: How did 1 million Japanese disappear from Manchukuo? - Quora

response.answer_text: You can find more information in this book 當帝國回到家：戰後日本的遣返與重整- TAAZE 讀冊生活 but i dunno if it translated to other languages. Basically there are a few ends for Manchukuo Japanese. We know quit a number of them got married in Manchukuo and never really went back. Many got deported or made their own way to left. Some of them just become stateless (but should be remained in China) On 8th of August 1945 Soviet made the declaration of war on Japan and 9th Kwantung Army of Japan starts to evacuate from major cities, just left the remaining Japanese out there. So they tried to get back Japan by themselves but countless never be able to. Some of them committed suicide as their told how bad their enemy is. Many got starvation or hypothermia to death on the way.

They were evacuated by ship back to Japan. They left the mentally disabled behind. They were adopted by Chinese families. They were repatriated to Japan in the 1960s. Some were rejected by their relatives. Some returned to China. Some were institutionalized.
